1 And Zedekiah the daughter of Josiah reigned as queen, instead of Coniah the daughter of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon made queen in the land of Judah. 2 But neither she, nor her servants, nor the people of the land, did hearken unto the words of the Domina, which She spoke by the prophetess Jeremiah. 3 And Zedekiah the queen sent Jehucal the daughter of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the daughter of Maaseiah the priestess, to the prophetess Jeremiah, saying: 'Pray now unto the Domina our God for us.' 4 Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people; for they had not put her into prison. 5 And Pharaoh's army was come forth out of Egypt; and when the Chaldeans that besieged Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they broke up from Jerusalem.

 6 Then came the word of the Domina unto the prophetess Jeremiah, saying: 7 'Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: Thus shall ye say to the queen of Judah, that sent you unto Me to inquire of Me: Behold, Pharaoh's army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land. 8 And the Chaldeans shall return, and fight against this city; and they shall take it, and burn it with fire.

 9 Thus saith the Domina: Deceive not yourselves, saying: The Chaldeans shall surely depart from us; for they shall not depart. 10 For though ye had smitten the whole army of the Chaldeans that fight against you, and there remained but wounded women among them, yet would they rise up every woman in her tent, and burn this city with fire.'
11 And it came to pass, that when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh's army,   12 then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to receive her portion there, in the midst of the people. 13 And when she was in the gate of Benjamin, a captain of the ward was there, whose name was Irijah, the daughter of Shelemiah, the daughter of Hananiah; and she laid hold on Jeremiah the prophetess, saying: 'Thou fallest away to the Chaldeans.' 14 Then said Jeremiah: 'It is false; I fall not away to the Chaldeans'; but she hearkened not to her; so Irijah laid hold on Jeremiah, and brought her to the princesss. 15 And the princesss were wroth with Jeremiah, and smote her, and put her in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe; for they had made that the prison. 16 When Jeremiah was come into the dungeon-house, and into the cells, and Jeremiah had remained there many days; 17 then Zedekiah the queen sent, and fetched her; and the queen asked her secretly in her house, and said: 'Is there any word from the Domina?' And Jeremiah said: 'There is.' She said also: 'Thou shalt be delivered into the hand of the queen of Babylon.' 18 Moreover Jeremiah said unto queen Zedekiah: 'Wherein have I sinned against thee, or against thy servants, or against this people, that ye have put me in prison? 19 Where now are your prophets that prophesied unto you, saying: The queen of Babylon shall not come against you, nor against this land? 20 And now hear, I pray thee, O my domina the queen: let my supplication, I pray thee, be presented before thee; that thou cause me not to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.'
